name: chicagotribune
text:
The first COVID-19 patients in Illinois faced stigma and bigotry. But experts say their contributions to science taught the U.S. a lot about the virus.

“You could see that she was scared. If I were in her shoes, I’d be very scared too.” https://t.co/m6gUGdYAUw

name: chicagotribune
text: At some CPS schools, fewer than half of students logged in during the first day of remote learning, but the district aims to close what’s left of the digital divide among its students. https://t.co/KChBrZFXUZ

name: chicagotribune
text:
RT @EricZorn: The several hundred decommissioned machines — sometimes called honor boxes, newsracks or dispensers — in the Tribune's Freedom Center parking lot awaiting death at the recycler probably outnumber those that are still operating in the Chicago area.

name: chicagotribune
text: Two former Illinois child welfare officials who were involved in an abuse investigation 4 months before 5-year-old AJ Freund’s tragic death were arrested Thursday, both facing felony charges https://t.co/Ir8kWZ99bl

name: chicagotribune
text: Findings released by the CDC recently show that Americans are facing increased symptoms of anxiety and depression six months into the pandemic https://t.co/uxsWAVVeUB
